comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See www.oldpostcards.com/indian.html and www.oldpostcards.com/i/ind000407.html for image of postcard using what appears to be this image (colored). Postcard is from Glacier National Park. Another copy of the postcard is at swcenter.fortlewis.edu/images/D002/D0020321Page.htm -- with 'circa 1908' as date. However Glacier National Park was not established as such until 1910.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.archive.org/details/pressclubbulleti00pres suggests that in November 1912, Medicine Owl, a Chief of the Blackfeet and "Chief of Medicine Men" was a luncheon guest at the Chicago Press Club. See print page 284. I think the date written on the negative is 1-18-13.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: swanq: Thanks for the additional information on Medicine Owl. We will add more details to the source data and then reload the description to Flickr.

comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Several articles about Medicine Owl ran in the Chicago Daily Tribune, November 24 and 28, 1913. A Nov 24 article states that he met with Mary Garden. LC uploaded photos of her recently as well, see around www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3065187159/ . The Nov 28 article says that he christened Italian opera singer Titta Ruffo with the name "Chee-ka-komeena, Thunder Chief". LC uploaded a photo ot Titta a few weeks ago, www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2949660224/ .

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called beautifulgorgeousgamilaharikabellissima, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
